TopicTitle: APOLLO (SATURN-V with F1 & J2, APOLLO CSM, LEM, LLRV). by OLDD (v.1.4. 09.05.14)

Articles.Content:
Very, very good mod!

Only question I have is how do the ALSEP instruments fit in the ALSEP box? I have KAS and VNG installed and I can't figure out how they actually go in the box?

Also, I'm guessing the rover rack is for Bobcat's LER?

ALSEP devices on its places (surface attached)

NO, not for Bobcat's LER. I doing my own replica lunar rover.
I can't seem to get any interior lights to activate. Should I redownload and install?
You have to push the button on the LEM console that says lights while in IVA.
Awesome job any chance of a completed craft file

ALSEP devices on its places (surface attached)

http://i.imgur.com/u0pOFRR.png

NO, not for Bobcat's LER. I doing my own replica lunar rover.

Ah I see. Do you think it might be possible to make the ALSEP box a KAS-style container in which the experiments can be stored?

And ah I see! Good to hear, looking forward to this very much

You have to push the button on the LEM console that says lights while in IVA.

I pressed it and the button activated but no lights turned on.

Great mod! I love it!

The idea to have dust clouds is compelling but be advised, in a vacuum they're very small, faint, disperse very quickly and exist only in the immediate vicinity of the rocket exhaust. Also they disappear immediately after engine shutdown.

I pressed it and the button activated but no lights turned on.

ya, yu right.

the answer is that you gotta to install external light device before launch.

There is only light switch onboard, not built-in external light device itself.

Flight and assembly manual will be ready soon...

Hi Denny,

First of all, nice job on the LEM! Looking forward to your next projects!

I see that you modelled those in 1:1, then rescaled in KSP to be 55% of the original size. I can easily rescale the parts back to 1:1 by cfg, however the IVA must be rescaled separately, and that's a lot (a LOT) of numbers! I was wondering if would be (relatively speaking) easy for you to make a separate package with 1:1 size, or it is too much of work?

ya, yu right.

the answer is that you gotta to install external light device before launch.

There is only light switch onboard, not built-in external light device itself.

Flight and assembly manual will be ready soon...

I like that. I like that a lot. Modularity all the way.
I must say WOW coolest internals ever
Can I delete the Fasa parts and keep the JSI folder and it work? the JSi folder is rRasterprop
great great work, is there any craft file that we can use ?
Hey Danny, I can not understand why SAS does not work... :\

The LEM doesn't have a reaction wheel, and I can't seem to set the LEM docking port as my target. I'm also a little confused as to why the LEM has a staging icon for landing gear and each stage in addition to the actually functional ones.

Can I delete the Fasa parts and keep the JSI folder and it work? the JSi folder is rRasterprop

yes, it will. and yes - JSI is RasterPropMonitor.

FASA version is a bit simplified than here.

great great work, is there any craft file that we can use ?

well, i'll prepare craft file. And will add assembly manual on first page.

Hey Danny, I can not understand why SAS does not work... :\

It works. but this is replica and real prototype does not had reaction wheels. And SAS is only a computer, and it needs actuators for doing something. Currently - RCS only. And systems works if you have monoprop and charge onboard. trying to be realistic device.

The LEM doesn't have a reaction wheel, and I can't seem to set the LEM docking port as my target. I'm also a little confused as to why the LEM has a staging icon for landing gear and each stage in addition to the actually functional ones.

You cant set this?

hmm. just checked, seems like all works. Ya, LEM docking cone is a small thingie, but this is replica, and real one was so uncomfortably placed.

Icons? i just love icons.

Edited March 2, 2014 by DennyTX

Hi Denny,

First of all, nice job on the LEM! Looking forward to your next projects!

I see that you modelled those in 1:1, then rescaled in KSP to be 55% of the original size. I can easily rescale the parts back to 1:1 by cfg, however the IVA must be rescaled separately, and that's a lot (a LOT) of numbers! I was wondering if would be (relatively speaking) easy for you to make a separate package with 1:1 size, or it is too much of work?

well, if folks want i'll can rescale internal. Not very much work.

The LEM doesn't have a reaction wheel, and I can't seem to set the LEM docking port as my target. I'm also a little confused as to why the LEM has a staging icon for landing gear and each stage in addition to the actually functional ones.

There is just a small ring on the docking port you can highlight to set as target.
For the Skylab will there be a optional parasol (it doesn't have to be deployable) and have both the parasol and the main body of the Skylab use the Reflection plugin?

1. New version of LEM.

1.1. docking instrument panel has been added.

1.2. some interior and exterior changes.

1.3. some tuning of parameters.

2. CSM docking device has been divided to separate download from LEM.

3. Very alpha LLRV (Lunar Landing Research Vehicle).

4. Gemini lander interior has been added.

check first page

Edited March 4, 2014 by DennyTX
If any one wants to use this mod with Remotetech 2 this give 2 dish targets and 1 omni. https://www.dropbox.com/s/lv91j4cllpohlef/LM_Antenna_RT2.cfg
Yay, a LLRV! Now to go eject like Neil. Hehe
Also, could you post pictures of the Gemini Lander, the LLRV and all other craft? I think that that would help along with a video of the LLRV. And also what do you mean by docking panel?

Your LLRV is very beautiful (like all your creations actually), but is there a chance to get a silvered LLRV instead of a golden one ?

And please, be indulgent with my spelling mistakes, I'm french.
